title: New `siblings` command
body:
Naming is analog to the `subdatasets` command that we already have. The purpose of this new command is to concentrate all code for sibling registration and meta data manipulation of siblings into a single command (set/change name, description, wanted policies, ....). Moreover, I would propose to treat "here" as another sibling and have the very same command also manipulate a standalone dataset.

In essence, all this command does are actions bound to a single dataset, plus a for-each-style recursive iteration of a dataset tree. For the latter we need to support a templating mechanism to e.g. transform a base URL to match a particular subdataset (so nothing new or fancy).

List of related, unaddressed issues and previous discussions -- not necessarily TODO items for this PR, but the changes here should make those simpler to implement:

- rewrite description #1484 
- sibling/dataset configuration via templates #1462 
- wanted policy setup #925 (related #921)
- registration via datalad RIs #1438 
- annex-only sibling tracking/update #1363
- figure out if we want to treat "here" as yet another sibling and have the very same command also manipulate a standalone dataset (e.g. for description, wanted, ....). If so, how to indicate this best? `--name` no name could be `here`, but the we would need something for "give me all info about all remotes".
- check (maybe via coverage) which parts of the legacy `add_sibling` became obsolete and gut the code accordingly
- insufficient documentation #1017 
- scary low-level logs #1519 

Actual TODOs:

- [x] generalize `add_sibling` to `siblings` command #1235 - [ ] 
- [x] `siblings` is new-style generator
- [x] `siblings` can remove a sibling (`remote remove`) #1483
- [x] all internal use of `add_sibling` is via `siblings`
- [x] tests for `siblings remove`
